Quick Message:Create predefined content to add in the email client so that users can write emails consistently and efficiently.
Email Template:You can create a different template for each table that uses the email client.

questions.question_text: When using the Email Client, what is the difference between an Email Template and a Quick Message?

choices.B: Email Template is defined and automatically applied when the email form launches; Quick Messages are defined and then can be manually applied by the user
choices.C: Email Templates are included with ITSM; Quick Messages are new with Machine Learning
choices.D: Email templates are defined by users with admin role; Quick Messages are defined by users with quick_message_admin role
choices.A: Email Templates are like forms that can be sent to the caller for completion; Quick Messages are primarily used by the Chat Bot

questions.question_text: Your customer wants incidents to close automatically 7 days after the incident is resolved. How do you meet this requirement? (Choose two.)

choices.C: From the Incident Properties application, set Enable auto closure of incidents based on Resolution date to Yes
choices.B: Update the incident_close UI action script
choices.D: Modify the Incident Lifecycle flow to expire after 7 days
choices.A: Modify the Incident Lifecycle flow to trigger from the Resolved date instead of the Updated date

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
servicenow.read.inkling.com
IT Service Management (ITSM) Implementation On Demand
Module 5.5: Incident Management
Page: Closure Timeframe

Answer is AC

Selected Answer: AC
Enable auto-close of incidents based on the resolution date of the incident instead of the last updated date. This property is set to true only for new customers. Existing customers must manually set the property to true.
The default time for resolved incidents to be closed by the system is seven days.

Selected Answer: AC
From the book:
Enable auto-close of incidents based on the resolution date of the incident instead of the last updated date. This property is set to true only for new customers. Existing customers must manually set the property to true.
The default time for resolved incidents to be closed by the system is seven days.

Selected Answer: AC
AC is correct. It's not D. Per pg 313 in the (Tokyo) ebook, "The default time for resolved incidents to be closed by the system is SEVEN days" already. Nothing to "modify"

Selected Answer: AC
A and C for sure
C for sure !

Selected Answer: AC
C for sure
you can also configure auto-closing of resolved incidents by modifying the incident lifecycle flow, in the auto close section, seelc the auto close check box under the resolved stage and set the auto-close incidents in days field to whatever days you want

Selected Answer: C
Technically, none of the answers are correct. Incident Properties is the place to do this, but both the "Enable autoclosure..." and "Number of days..." properties would be set. Alternatively, these properties can be looked up in System Properties.

Selected Answer: C
C for sure
A? D?
CD is correct

A or D????
C is for sure

C is correct for sure.
ITSM implementation (Tokyo) ebook pg 313.

Selected Answer: AC
AC is correct.

correct answer should be CD.
Letter A is focused on Flow triggers which initially does not make sense because the question is for incident closure not incident creation.

Selected Answer: D
A record producer is a specific type of catalog item that allows end users to create task-based records, such as incident records, from the service catalog.
https://docs.servicenow.com/ja-JP/bundle/utah-servicenow-platform/page/product/service-catalog-management/concept/c_RecordProducer.html

questions.question_text: Your customer wants to use the Service Catalog to generate task-based records for end-user inquiries. What Service Catalog capability can you use to generate these records?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The overall catalog is made up of a collection of discrete catalog items.
The basic Service Catalog item types include:

Standard catalog items
Record producers: giving alternative ways of adding information such as Incidents via the service catalog.
Order guides: to group multiple catalog items in one request.
Content Items: catalog items which provide information instead of goods or services.

Selected Answer: B
Correct
The basic Service Catalog item types include:

・Standard catalog items
・Record producers: giving alternative ways of adding information such as Incidents via the service catalog.
Order guides: to group multiple catalog items in one request.
Content Items: catalog items which provide information instead of goods or services.

https://docs.servicenow.com/ja-JP/bundle/utah-servicenow-platform/page/product/service-catalog-management/concept/c_IntroductionToCatalogItems.html
